name: Roo.LayoutDialog

config.name: listeners
y
config.desc: The default top page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

config.name: modal
config.desc: True to show the dialog modally, preventing user interaction with the rest of the page (defaults to false)

config.name: animateTarget
config.desc:
Id or element from which the dialog should animate while opening
(defaults to null with no animation)

config.name: shadow
config.desc:
True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right
shadow (defaults to false)

config.name: autoScroll
config.desc: True to allow the dialog body contents to overflow and display scrollbars (defaults to false)

config.name: collapsible
config.desc: False to remove the built-in top-right corner collapse button (defaults to true)

config.name: autoTabs
config.desc: If true, all elements with class 'x-dlg-tab' will get automatically converted to tabs (defaults to false)

config.name: shadowOffset
config.desc: The number of pixels to offset the shadow if displayed (defaults to 5)

config.name: buttons
config.desc: Array of buttons

config.name: minButtonWidth
config.desc: Minimum width of all dialog buttons (defaults to 75)

config.name: title
config.desc: Default text to display in the title bar (defaults to null)

config.name: minWidth
config.desc: The minimum allowable width for a resizable dialog (defaults to 200)

config.name: buttonAlign
config.desc: Valid values are "left," "center" and "right" (defaults to "right")

config.name: autoCreate
config.desc: True to auto create from scratch, or using a DomHelper Object (defaults to false)

config.name: minHeight
config.desc: The minimum allowable height for a resizable dialog (defaults to 80)

config.name: proxyDrag
config.desc:
True to drag a lightweight proxy element rather than the dialog itself, used when
draggable = true (defaults to false)

config.name: shim
config.desc: True to create an iframe shim that prevents selects from showing through (defaults to false)

config.name: width
config.desc: Width of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

config.name: constraintoviewport
config.desc: True to keep the dialog constrained within the visible viewport boundaries (defaults to true)

config.name: syncHeightBeforeShow
config.desc: True to cause the dimensions to be recalculated before the dialog is shown (defaults to false)

config.name: tabTag
config.desc: The tag name of tab elements, used when autoTabs = true (defaults to 'div')

config.name: resizable
config.desc: False to disable manual dialog resizing (defaults to true)

config.name: closable
config.desc: False to remove the built-in top-right corner close button (defaults to true)

config.name: fixedcenter
config.desc: True to ensure that anytime the dialog is shown or resized it gets centered (defaults to false)

config.name: height
config.desc: Height of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

config.name: resizeHandles
config.desc:
Which resize handles to display - see the {@link Roo.Resizable} handles config
property for valid values (defaults to 'all')

config.name: x
config.desc: The default left page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

config.name: draggable
config.desc: False to disable dragging of the dialog within the viewport (defaults to true)

methods.name: addxtype
methods.desc: Add an xtype element (actually adds to the layout.)

methods.name: getLayout
methods.desc: Get the BorderLayout for this dialog

methods.name: endUpdate
methods.desc: Ends update of the layout <strike>and resets display to none</strike>. Use standard beginUpdate/endUpdate on the layout.

methods.name: beginUpdate
methods.desc: Begins an update of the layout <strike>and sets display to block and visibility to hidden</strike>. Use standard beginUpdate/endUpdate on the layout.

methods.name: expand
methods.desc:
Expands a collapsed dialog back to its normal state.  Equivalent to the user
clicking the expand dialog button.

methods.name: alignTo
methods.desc: Aligns the dialog to the specified element

params.name: element
params.desc: The element to align to.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position to align to (see {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for more details).

params.name: offsets
params.desc: (optional) Offset the positioning by [x, y]

methods.name: setTitle
methods.desc: Sets the dialog title text

params.name: text
params.desc: The title text to display

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Returns true if the dialog is visible

methods.name: resizeTo
methods.desc: Resizes the dialog.

methods.name: center
methods.desc: Centers this dialog in the viewport

methods.name: collapse
methods.desc:
Collapses the dialog to its minimized state (only the title bar is visible).
Equivalent to the user clicking the collapse dialog button.

methods.name: initTabs
methods.desc: Reinitializes the tabs component, clearing out old tabs and finding new ones.

methods.name: toFront
methods.desc: Brings this dialog to the front of any other visible dialogs

methods.name: moveTo
methods.desc: Moves the dialog's top-left corner to the specified point

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hides the dialog.

params.name: callback
params.desc: (optional) Function to call when the dialog is hidden

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc:
Destroys this dialog and all its supporting elements (including any tabs, shim,
shadow, proxy, mask, etc.)  Also removes all event listeners.

params.name: removeEl
params.desc: (optional) true to remove the element from the DOM

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Shows the dialog.

params.name: animateTarget
params.desc: (optional) Reset the animation target

methods.name: anchorTo
methods.desc: Anchors an element to another element and realigns it when the window is resized.

params.name: element
params.desc: The element to align to.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position to align to (see {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for more details)

params.name: offsets
params.desc: (optional) Offset the positioning by [x, y]

params.name: monitorScroll
params.desc:
(optional) true to monitor body scroll and reposition. If this parameter
is a number, it is used as the buffer delay (defaults to 50ms).

methods.name: addButton
methods.desc: Adds a button to the footer section of the dialog.

params.name: config
params.desc:
A string becomes the button text, an object can either be a Button config
object or a valid Roo.DomHelper element config

params.name: handler
params.desc: The function called when the button is clicked

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope of the handler function (accepts position as a property)

methods.name: addKeyListener
methods.desc:
Adds a key listener for when this dialog is displayed.  This allows you to hook in a function that will be
executed in response to a particular key being pressed while the dialog is active.

params.name: key
params.desc:
Either the numeric key code, array of key codes or an object with the following options:
                                 {key: (number or array), shift: (true/false), ctrl: (true/false), alt: (true/false)}

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope of the function

methods.name: focus
methods.desc:
Focuses the dialog.  If a defaultButton is set, it will receive focus, otherwise the
dialog itself will receive focus.

methods.name: getTabs
methods.desc:
Returns the TabPanel component (creates it if it doesn't exist).
Note: If you wish to simply check for the existence of tabs without creating them,
check for a null 'tabs' property.

methods.name: setDefaultButton
methods.desc: Sets the default button to be focused when the dialog is displayed.

params.name: btn
params.desc: The button object returned by {@link #addButton}

methods.name: toBack
methods.desc: Sends this dialog to the back (under) of any other visible dialogs

methods.name: setContentSize
methods.desc: Resizes the dialog to fit the specified content size.

methods.name: restoreState
methods.desc: Restores the previous state of the dialog if Roo.state is configured.

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the element for this dialog

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional)

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to release

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to capture

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options

events.name: *move
events.desc: Fires when this dialog is moved by the user.

params.name: x
params.desc: The new page X

params.name: y
params.desc: The new page Y

events.name: *resize
events.desc: Fires when this dialog is resized by the user.

params.name: width
params.desc: The new width

params.name: height
params.desc: The new height

events.name: *beforehide
events.desc: Fires before this dialog is hidden.

events.name: *beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before this dialog is shown.

events.name: *hide
events.desc: Fires when this dialog is hidden.

events.name: *show
events.desc: Fires when this dialog is shown.

events.name: *keydown
events.desc: Fires when a key is pressed
